pullRequest.title: Support enableCompression in workflow and job configs
pullRequest.bodyText:
Issues

 My PR addresses the following Helix issues and references them in the PR description:

Fixes #884
Description

 Here are some details about my PR, including screenshots of any UI changes:

Previously, there was no way for users to set enableCompression in workflows and jobs configs. This allows them to set that field in the Builder.
Tests

 The following is the result of the "mvn test" command on the appropriate module:

Failed tests: 
  TestEnableCompression.testEnableCompressionResource:108 expected:<true> but was:<false>
  TestHelixAdminCli.testDeactivateCluster:604 » Helix There are still LEADER in ...

Tests run: 1087, Failures: 2, Errors: 0, Skipped: 1

[INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------
[INFO] BUILD FAILURE
[INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------
[INFO] Total time:  01:08 h
[INFO] Finished at: 2020-03-11T23:48:14-07:00
[INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------

Results :

Tests run: 11, Failures: 0, Errors: 0, Skipped: 0

[INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------
[INFO] BUILD SUCCESS
[INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------
[INFO] Total time:  47.491 s
[INFO] Finished at: 2020-03-12T09:48:20-07:00
[INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------

Commits

 My commits all reference appropriate Apache Helix GitHub issues in their subject lines. In addition, my commits follow the guidelines from "How to write a good git commit message":

Subject is separated from body by a blank line
Subject is limited to 50 characters (not including Jira issue reference)
Subject does not end with a period
Subject uses the imperative mood ("add", not "adding")
Body wraps at 72 characters
Body explains "what" and "why", not "how"



Code Quality

 My diff has been formatted using helix-style.xml
(helix-style-intellij.xml if IntelliJ IDE is used)

commit.message:
Support enableCompression in workflow and job configs

Previously, there was no way for users to set enableCompression in workflows and jobs configs. This allows them to set that field in the Builder.

nodes.bodyText:
It is redundant to check containsKey: if the value is not set, parseBoolean still returns false.
Unless the default value enableCompression is true, but I don't think this should be the case.
No need to check containsKey, unless the default value enableCompression is true.
Then we should do a check here, right? If get null, we will get exception for parse boolean.

afterCommit.message:
Support enableCompression in workflow and job configs

Previously, there was no way for users to set enableCompression in workflows and jobs configs. This allows them to set that field in the Builder.
